alert.note: Alert for Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 08 at 8:00PM EDT until August 08 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF BRYAN...SCREVEN...BULLOCH...EFFINGHAM...CHATHAM... HAMPTON AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 759 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stilson, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 725 PM EDT the Metter Airport measured a 64 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include: Statesboro, Springfield, Rincon, Port Wentworth, Guyton, Brooklet, Newington, Oliver, Furman, Egypt, Stillwell, Pineora, Leefield, Kildare, and Ebenezer. This warning includes the following interstates: I-16 between mile markers 123 and 141. I-95 in Georgia between mile markers 111 and 112. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
